definitions: make a problem bad situation or negative feeling worse or more severe
examples: Stress can exacerbate health problems
His comments only exacerbated the tension

definitions: understand something deeply after much thought
measure the depth of water using a sounding line
examples: I cannot fathom why she left so suddenly
It's hard to fathom the complexity of space
Sailors used to fathom the ocean depth
They fathomed the lake at its center

definitions: shock or excite someone into taking action or making effort
examples: The speech galvanized the crowd into action
The crisis galvanized public opinion

definitions: bleed heavily and uncontrollably from ruptured blood vessel
lose something valuable rapidly and in large amounts
examples: The patient began to hemorrhage after surgery
Apply pressure to stop the hemorrhaging
The company hemorrhaged money during the recession
The team hemorrhaged talent to competitors

definitions: light up something with bright light making visible
help to clarify or explain something making it understandable
examples: Candles illuminate the dining room
Street lamps illuminate the path at night
The professor illuminated complex theories beautifully
Her research illuminates this historical period

definitions: put something or someone in danger of loss harm or failure
examples: Don't jeopardize your health by smoking
His actions could jeopardize the entire project

definitions: take a claim or dispute to court for legal proceedings
examples: They decided to litigate rather than settle
The case has been litigated for years

definitions: wander at random without definite aim or direction
follow a winding course like a river or path
examples: Tourists meandered through the old streets
We meandered around the park all afternoon
The river meanders through the valley
The hiking trail meanders up the mountain

definitions: make something necessary as a result or consequence requiring action
examples: The storm necessitated evacuation of residents
Budget cuts necessitate staff reductions

definitions: move or swing back and forth at regular speed between positions
examples: The pendulum oscillates with perfect rhythm
Fan blades oscillate to spread cool air

definitions: make something continue indefinitely especially something harmful or undesirable
examples: These policies perpetuate inequality in society
Don't perpetuate harmful stereotypes

definitions: represent the most perfect or typical example of quality or class
examples: She is the quintessential teacher everyone loves
Paris remains the quintessential romantic city

definitions: voluntarily cease to keep or claim something giving up possession
examples: He refused to relinquish control of the company
She relinquished her claim to the property

definitions: examine or inspect closely and thoroughly looking for flaws or details
examples: The detective scrutinized every piece of evidence
Voters should scrutinize candidates' records carefully

definitions: torment or tease someone with sight or promise of something unobtainable
examples: The smell of baking bread tantalized hungry customers
Don't tantalize the dog with food he can't have

definitions: damage or weaken something gradually especially someone's power or authority
examples: Constant criticism undermined her confidence
Scandal undermined the politician's credibility

definitions: clear someone of blame or suspicion by proving them right
examples: The evidence vindicated her claims completely
Time vindicated his investment strategy

definitions: move in quivering way or flicker unsteadily
be undecided between choices showing doubt or indecision
examples: The candle flame wavered in the breeze
His voice wavered with emotion
She never wavered in her commitment
Don't waver when making important decisions

definitions: make something bad or unsatisfactory better through improvement or change
examples: New policies should ameliorate working conditions
Nothing could ameliorate his grief

definitions: surround a place with armed forces to capture it
overwhelm someone with requests or complaints persistently
examples: Enemy troops besieged the castle for months
The army besieged the fortified city
Reporters besieged the celebrity with questions
Fans besieged the box office for tickets

definitions: find a way around an obstacle or avoid something cleverly
examples: They circumvented the law through loopholes
Hackers circumvented the security system

definitions: make someone or something weak or infirm reducing strength
examples: The illness debilitated him for months
Chronic pain can debilitate daily activities

definitions: set free from legal social or political restrictions giving liberty
examples: Lincoln emancipated slaves with his proclamation
Education emancipates people from ignorance

definitions: make an action or process easy or easier to accomplish
examples: Good planning facilitates project completion
Technology facilitates communication across distances

definitions: begin to grow and put out shoots after dormancy
come into existence and develop gradually over time
examples: Seeds germinate when conditions are right
Plant the seeds and wait for them to germinate
The idea germinated in her mind slowly
Plans for the business germinated over coffee

definitions: experience apparent perception of something not present caused by disorder
examples: High fever made him hallucinate strange visions
Some medications can cause patients to hallucinate

definitions: prevent something or someone from moving or operating normally
examples: The cast will immobilize your broken arm
Snow immobilized traffic for hours

definitions: place things close together to show contrasting effect or comparison
examples: The artist juxtaposed light and dark colors
The film juxtaposes wealth and poverty

definitions: lose or lack vitality growing weak or feeble
be forced to remain in unpleasant place or situation
examples: Plants languish without proper water and sunlight
His health languished during the long illness
Prisoners languished in dark cells for years
The proposal languished in committee

definitions: make something less severe serious or painful reducing negative impact
examples: Insurance helps mitigate financial losses
Trees mitigate air pollution in cities

definitions: make something ineffective by applying opposite force or effect
examples: Antacids neutralize stomach acid quickly
Security forces neutralized the threat

definitions: deliberately make something unclear or difficult to understand confusing others
examples: Legal jargon obfuscates the contract's meaning
Politicians often obfuscate controversial issues

definitions: spread throughout something penetrating every part of area or object
examples: The smell of coffee permeated the office
Joy permeated the atmosphere at the party

definitions: isolate person animal or place to prevent spread of disease
examples: They quarantined travelers for two weeks
The ship was quarantined at the port

definitions: respond to gesture or action by making corresponding one in return
examples: She reciprocated his feelings of love
Always reciprocate kindness when you can

definitions: provide evidence to support or prove truth of claim or statement
examples: You must substantiate your claims with facts
Research substantiated the new theory

definitions: go beyond limits set by law or morality breaking rules
examples: Those who transgress the law face punishment
Don't transgress the boundaries of good taste

definitions: take position of power or importance illegally or by force
examples: The general tried to usurp the throne
Don't let anyone usurp your authority

definitions: speak or write about someone in abusively disparaging manner
examples: The press vilified him unfairly
Political opponents vilify each other constantly

definitions: make something more noticeable or prominent emphasizing particular features
examples: Makeup can accentuate your best features
The lighting accentuates the room's warmth

definitions: divide into two branches or parts splitting from common point
examples: The river bifurcates at the delta
The path bifurcates near the old oak tree

definitions: cease to resist an opponent or demand surrendering under agreed conditions
examples: The army capitulated after the long siege
He finally capitulated to their demands

definitions: describe or portray something precisely showing exact detail or outline
examples: The contract delineates each party's responsibilities
Maps delineate territorial boundaries clearly

definitions: mention things one by one in list counting or naming separately
examples: Please enumerate your reasons for leaving
The report enumerates all policy violations

definitions: invent or concoct something typically with deceitful intent
construct or manufacture something from prepared components
examples: He fabricated an elaborate excuse for being late
Witnesses can fabricate stories under pressure
Workers fabricate steel beams at the factory
The company fabricates custom furniture

definitions: move toward or be attracted to person or thing naturally
examples: Children gravitate toward colorful toys
People gravitate to those with similar interests

definitions: put forward hypothesis or theory as explanation for something
examples: Scientists hypothesize about the cause of extinction
Researchers hypothesize that diet affects mood

definitions: prevent someone from functioning normally through injury illness or disability
examples: The accident incapacitated him for several months
Migraine headaches can incapacitate sufferers completely

definitions: throw or drop something from aircraft or ship to lighten load
abandon or discard something no longer wanted hastily
examples: The pilot jettisoned fuel before emergency landing
Ships jettison cargo during severe storms
Companies jettison unprofitable divisions quickly
He jettisoned his old beliefs

definitions: make something legitimate lawful or acceptable in society or law
examples: The new law legitimizes same-sex marriages
Success legitimized his unconventional methods
